post_text: SWMS student Grace Chenxin Liu was selected as a Long Island Scholar of Mathematics for the academic year 2020-2021! Grace will participate in the Institute of Creative Problem Solving for Gifted and Talented Students at SUNY College at Old Westbury. Selection by the Institute into their annual program indicates that she is among the top one-tenth of one percent of all students in mathematics on Long Island in her grade! She competed against approximately 700 outstanding students who were nominated by their schools, and only approx. 25 students at her age were finally selected on criteria such as a rigorous entrance exam, a recommendation from the student's math teacher, a school transcript and a brief statement written by the student. Congratulations Grace! #syostrong

Governor Cuomo announced today that he extended the order to close all schools in New York until at least April 15. At that time, the state will reassess whether to extend the school closures further. The waiver of the 180-day mandate has also been extended.

Spring Recess is scheduled to begin on Thursday, April 9, and as previously communicated, will take place as originally planned. As the state makes further announcements about the schools, we will continue to update the community.

post_text: Congratulations to Spencer Rubin, who has been named a 2020 National YoungArts Foundation Finalist in Classical Music, the organization’s highest honor. Spencer, a 15-year old oboist, has been recognized for his artistic achievement and joins 20 of the nation’s most accomplished classical musicians as Finalists. This year’s Finalists represent the top 2.1% of thousands of applicants in visual, literary and performing arts disciplines. Spencer will receive a cash prize of up to $10,000 and will participate in National YoungArts Week (January 5—12, 2020), the organization’s signature program. As a Finalist, Spencer will be eligible to be nominated to become a U.S. Presidential Scholar in the Arts, one of the highest honors given to high school seniors bestowed by the President of the United States. Congratulations to SHS alum Monet Yuan, Class of 2018, who co-authored a paper published in Science Translational Medicine on the topic of targeting proteins in cancer treatment. Monet conducted research at the Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory as a member of the Partners for the Future program during her senior year at Syosset High School and continued her work at the lab since completing the program. The research team she was a part of, working under the mentorship of Dr. Jason Sheltzer, discovered that current cancer treatments may be targeting the wrong proteins. The team's research identified potential new targets for treatment. The District is very proud of Monet and commends her on this very important work!

A Message From the Superintendent...
I would like to make you aware that this morning there was a false report posted to social media of a police investigation related to a threat made to the high school. There have been no threats and therefore there is no investigation. Reports of police activity are false.

Out of an abundance of caution, District Security has conducted a sweep of the building and has found nothing unusual or suspicious.

The District immediately reported the matter to Homeland Security, who deemed this to be a false report and confirmed there is no threat and they are not engaged in an investigation. Homeland Security is now looking into the origins of the false report.

Sincerely,
Dr. Tom Rogers

Each year on 9/11, we pause to acknowledge the day, the bravery and sacrifice of first responders, and the loss that so many experienced. Our thoughts are with the many families that still live with the consequences of that day.

Days ago, the State designated today as a “Day of Remembrance” to encourage observance, discussion and education in the classroom of the historical events that took place 18 years ago. Our school calendar initially had an event scheduled for this evening, which we ultimately concluded may hinder too many families from attending their own remembrances and memorials. The event was rescheduled to a later date. I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience this late decision to reschedule may have caused.

The newly named September 11th Remembrance Day was honored today in our schools with a moment of silence as we remembered the victims, their loved ones and the first responders, and we keep them in our thoughts today and always.

~Tom Rogers

ADL’s No Place for Hate initiative identifies schools and communities who demonstrate a long-term commitment to combating bias, bullying and hatred while leading initiatives for creating and maintaining a positive climate. Today, SHS students Aafia Alladin and Mark Kimoto, along with class advisors Dale Iovine, Rich Cafiero, Greg Cardona and Matt Loew, Library Media Specialist Sarah Wasser, Principal Dr. Durante and Assist. Principal Mr. Steinberg attended a ceremony in Manhattan to receive Syosset’s NPFH banner. Congratulations to the entire student body for their hard work and dedication to receive this designation!

Thank you again to all of the residents who participated in the 2019-20 school district budget vote and trustee election. Affidavit ballots were officially counted, and the final vote totals are as follows:

Proposition 1 School Budget 2019-2020: Passed 1,677 – 737
Proposition 2 Expenditure of Capital Reserve Funds: Passed 1,834 – 705
Proposition 3 Syosset Public Library Budget for 2019-2020: Passed 1,763 – 741

Board of Education Election:
Tracy Frankel, Rob Gershon and Susan Parker have been re-elected. Thomas A. Rotolo was also elected. Ms. Parker will fill out the balance of the one-year term currently vacant due to resignation.

Final vote totals are as follows:
Tracy Frankel 1,501
Rob Gershon 1,375
Court Cousins 1,241
Dr. Uzma Syed 1,177
Susan Parker 1,276
Thomas A. Rotolo 1,288

Congratulations to Coach Cafiero on receiving the the Coach of the Year Award from the New York State Public High School Athletic Association (NYSPHAA)!

“Caf cares about every athlete, in both their athletic and personal endeavors, and that is what separates him from other coaches” said SHS student-athlete Sean Ahearn. “Caf has positively impacted the lives of hundreds of student-athletes who have come under his guidance in the past few years.”

Reminder! The annual District Election and Budget Vote will take place tomorrow, May 21.

A second proposition on the ballot seeks the public’s approval to authorize the District to use a combination of an existing fund balance, reserves and state grant funds to pay the cost difference of upgraded replacement classroom doors that offer added security features including ﬁrearm resistance and a “one-button lockdown” remotely controlled locking mechanism. The District has prepared a Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) document to provide the community with information regarding the proposition. This FAQ document, along with the 2019-2020 Budget presentations and information, can be found on the Budget Information page of the District website: https://www.syossetschools.org/domain/115
